meanings.definition: A typical example or pattern of something
meanings.sent1: In our class, we studied different paradigms of animal behavior.
meanings.sent2: The scientist presented various paradigms to explain the phenomenon.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer created a paradigm of the perfect outfit for the runway.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork challenged the traditional paradigms of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a visual paradigm to help students understand the concept better.

meanings.definition: A set of linguistic forms all of which contain a particular element, especially the set of all inflected forms based on a single stem or theme
meanings.sent1: The language textbook explained different paradigms of verb conjugation.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study the paradigms of nouns and verbs in various languages.
meanings.sent3: The playful child created a funny paradigm of made-up words.
meanings.sent4: The poet's words painted a vivid paradigm of emotions.
meanings.sent5: Learning different paradigms of grammar can be challenging but rewarding.
